text:
Anyone know how do we know whether ACA is enabled?

The env variable : - MEMBERSRVC_CA_ACA_ENABLED=true looks to be not working.

Can someone please explain me if there is an equivalent of "gas" (a concept of turing-completeness from Ethereum) which defines how long a given chaincode would run until it gets extinguished by VPs? I assume there is no such a thing and therefore, there are no limits to the amount of time and resources that can be used by a chaincode executed in PBFT-driven network
If this is the case, what security measures can be possibly taken in case a malicious code is executed by a rogue party?
<@U1P1ZV6RF> Not quite sure if this will answer your question but chaincode can be anything and will run indefinitely.
In terms of security the peers are designed to run in a trusted network with trusted users
of course that doesn't exclude the case of a malicious user, but that is the point of the design
